image.altText: An Aboriginal flag blows in the wind, with bushes and pink flowers in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The ACT government proudly labels itself as progressive and was the only jurisdiction in Australia to vote for the Voice to Parliament in the referendum. So, how does Australia's capital fare when graded on the quality of life of its First Nations people?

title.children: 'We need to change the way we do business': First Nations youth incarceration rate rises

image.altText: A man in a black windbreaker, black cap, black sunglasses and white face mask walks next to a man in a barrister's gown.

props.synopsis: A successful appeal by prosecutors sees former traditional Chinese massage therapist Weiqing Lui's jail sentence for sexually assaulting six clients doubled.

title.children: Canberra massage therapist who sexually assaulted six women has jail time doubled

image.altText: A bronze statue of a woman smiling.

props.synopsis: Susan Ryan was the first female Labor minister and the first female minister for women during her career as part of the Hawke government in the 1980s.

title.children: Statue of late senator Susan Ryan, who championed women in politics, unveiled in Canberra

image.altText: A post-impressionist painting of a green field with farmhouses behind, three with red roofs and one with a blue roof.

props.synopsis: The blue roof, or Farm at Le Pouldu, by post-impressionist Paul Gauguin is purchased by the National Gallery of Australia, making it the first of his paintings to enter an Australian public collection.

title.children: National Gallery of Australia spends $9.8 million on painting by controversial artist Paul Gauguin

image.altText: GPS tracker on an ankle with person wearing a black shoe.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Liberals are proposing that some serious offenders who have been granted bail should be fitted with electronic monitoring.

title.children: Opposition proposes ankle bracelets for those accused of 'serious offences' on bail in the ACT

image.altText: A group of men throw peace signs for the camera

props.synopsis: Iran blames Israel for the assassination of a Hamas leader in Tehran this week, saying it has a "duty" to seek revenge. So, what might Iran do next?

title.children: An assassination on Iranian soil is a 'huge, humiliating blow'. Here are the three ways they might respond

image.altText: Mollie O'Callaghan, Lani Pallister, Bri Throssell, Ariarne Titmus stand and smiel

props.synopsis: Led by the two greatest 200m swimmers of all time, Australia came together once again to create an unstoppable winning machine at last.

title.children: Titmus's 'personal vendetta' burns as rivals come together to lead Aussies to a golden victory

image.altText: Fighters in camouflage stand in front of a coffin with a large picture of Fuad Shukr displayed on the wall behind

props.synopsis: The leader of Lebanese militant group Hezbollah warns that the conflict with Israel is in a "new phase", as he addresses mourners at the funeral of a commander from the group who was killed by an Israeli air strike this week in Beirut.

title.children: Hezbollah leader says war with Israel has entered 'new phase' after killings of top militant figures

image.altText: Rex Airlines logo on the fuselage of one of its aircraft, 2007

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Rex Airlines employees have been officially let go from the regional carrier after receiving formal notices of termination.

title.children: Rex Airlines employees receive termination notices after being told business was 'not viable'

image.altText: A photo of Joya (right) and her husband (left) hugging.

props.synopsis: In light of a potentially escalating war between Lebanon and Israel, Australians in Lebanon are asked to leave and others are told to avoid travel. But many won't be deterred.

title.children: Lebanese Australians say they're 'used to' travel warnings. It won't stop their holiday plans

image.altText: A group of people in a small aircraft cabin, with an American flag.

props.synopsis: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich and ex-marine Paul Whelan, who the US says were jailed in Russia after "sham" trials, are among 24 people freed in a global prisoner swap involving at least seven countries.

title.children: Americans freed from Russian penal colonies in largest East-West prisoner swap since Cold War

image.altText: A young child participates in the opening ceremony of the 2017 Garma Festival.

props.synopsis: After fire, a new life cycle begins — and in the 10 months since the defeat of the Voice to Parliament referendum, the conditions are right for new ideas to germinate.

title.children: Fire clears a way for new ideas to flourish at the first Garma since the defeat of the Voice

image.altText: Drone photos of the Kwinana big battery Stage One

props.synopsis: Like much of the country, WA is embracing rooftop solar with breathtaking gusto. But the state's position as the world's biggest island grid is posing a unique problem with authorities asking the question — how much solar is too much solar?

title.children: How the rise of solar power in Western Australia is a cautionary tale for the world

image.altText: A composite impage of Jess Fox biting her gold medal, a McDonald's icon and a portrait photo of Robert Downey Jr.

props.synopsis: It's time to test your knowledge about the news of the week.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Australia's pot of gold, a McDonald's first, and Robert Downey Jr's return

image.altText: A small crowd of people walking past buildings in a city on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The UK's central bank cut interest rates for the first time since 2020 overnight, while Wall Street ended sharply lower after economic data out of the US spooked investors. Follow live.

title.children: Australian shares plummet as concerns mount over global economic slowdown

image.altText: An image showing three people side-by-side - two men and a woman.

props.synopsis: Twenty-four prisoners are released in what is believed to be the largest prisoner swap between the West and Russia since the Cold War.

title.children: Who are the prisoners involved in the largest US-Russia swap since the Cold War?

image.altText: GettyImages-2164158332

props.synopsis: Boris Van Der Vorst defends the IOC over its handling of gender testing, as an Italian boxer quits mid-fight against Algerian Imane Khelif.

title.children: 'Sad situation for all boxers': Head of World Boxing addresses issues over gender after Italian boxer quits mid-round

image.altText: Bede1

props.synopsis: Surfing judge Ben Lowe is relieved of his duties at the Paris Olympics surfing after taking a photo with Australian surfer Ethan Ewing,

title.children: Australian surfing judge sent home from Paris Olympics after controversial photo in Tahiti

image.altText: a man eating in a hotel room

props.synopsis: Low-acuity public patients from a Gold Coast hospital are being treated at a nearby hotel as part of a program to help free up emergency beds, but many say such initiatives only offer short-term solutions.

title.children: Public patients treated at Gold Coast hotels as hospital-bed pressure soars

image.altText: Simone Biles looks relaxed as a swarm of cameras surround her

props.synopsis: Simone Biles is quite clearly the greatest gymnast to have ever lived, but that doesn't go far enough to describe her impact. The scenes in Paris as she won yet another Olympic gold prove she is far more than a champion athlete.

title.children: The Simone Biles experience has transcended sport and become the hottest ticket in Paris

image.altText: Clare Looker appears serious, standing in front of an artwork at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Victorian health authorities are providing an update on an outbreak of Legionnaires' disease which has resulted in dozens of people being sent to hospital.

title.children: Victorian Legionnaires' disease outbreak swells to at least 60 cases, authorities providing update

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Weather patterns may have spread Legionnaires' disease bacteria
A woman in her 90s with the disease has died

props.synopsis: Industry experts and peak tourism bodies say the collapse of Rex Airlines means the system is broken, with fears many regional centres will miss out on the tourist dollar as a result.

title.children: Aviation experts say the industry is 'broken' and tourism operators are fearing the worst

image.altText: A group photo of Anthony Albanese and 16 other members of government.

props.synopsis: The prime minister's reshuffle tells us much about political realities — and political problems.

title.children: Albanese's ministry reshuffle is another nail in the coffin of a republic. It also says a lot about the political problems he's facing

image.altText: Cass walks with a deer slung over her shoulder.

props.synopsis: Seeking a direct connection with what they eat, these people have turned to hunting wild animals in Victoria's forests.

title.children: These meat-eaters don't want to 'contract the kill', so they're heading into Victoria's forests to find their own meat

image.altText: A photographer looks up while holding a lighting device at the Milky Way surrounded by leafless trees

props.synopsis: It might be chilly, but Australia’s night sky puts on a dazzling show at this time of year – and this weekend is particularly good if you have clear weather. Rug up and use our guide to see if you can spot some of our winter wonders.

title.children: Australia gets a front-row seat to some of the best night skies in the world in winter

image.altText: Deliberately blurry headshot of James Blake with a short beard wearing collared shirt

props.synopsis: James Blake no longer has a major label deal, so he's becoming an "armchair expert" in the ways of the music business. He shares what he's learnt, and what's coming next.

title.children: James Blake no longer has a record deal and he couldn't be more excited about it

image.altText: Police tape in the foreground with trees and car in the background

props.synopsis: Police are calling for the driver of a vehicle to come forward after a 37-year-old woman was killed in an alleged hit-and-run on a Mossman road.

title.children: Woman killed in alleged hit-and-run in Far North Queensland

image.altText: A woman lays in the back seat of a car on a pillow during the day.

props.synopsis: Jaki earns too much to be eligible for social housing, so she's living out of her car instead. Queensland's income threshold is $609 a week.

title.children: This 58-year-old earns $609 a week but can't afford rent and isn't eligible for social housing

image.altText: Mountain fire 2

props.synopsis: As a picturesque Canadian national park burns out of control, some of Australia's most skilled bush fire fighters have answered the call for help.

title.children: Queensland fire fighters called to battle wildfires in Canadian national park

image.altText: A sketch drawing shows a teenage boy with his head in his hands. He is sitting next to three men.

props.synopsis: The teenager suspected to have killed three children in Southport, England on Monday has been named.

title.children: Teenage Southport murder suspect named after three children killed

image.altText: A dog with brown curly hair sits in the middle of a dirt road surrounded by grass.

props.synopsis: Owners of dogs bought from breeder Tasmanian Labradoodles have spoken out about significant problems and large vet bills, after the breeder reached an out-of-court agreement with the RSPCA to shut down immediately.

title.children: 'It wasn't the right dog': Labradoodle owners consider legal action after Tasmanian business shuts amid overbreeding allegations

image.altText: A woman with brown hair.

props.synopsis: When Danielle Carroll's sister Kelly Wilkinson was murdered by her estranged husband, she became the carer for Kelly's children. While they were surrounded support at first, months later it began to slow down.

title.children: Children of domestic homicide victims can 'fall through the cracks'. Danielle is working to do something about it

image.altText: A sign that says "Teen Challenge Grace Academy Grace Chapel".

props.synopsis: An alcohol and drug rehabilitation provider near Esperance vows to review its program after former residents raise concerns about its reliance on unqualified staff and limited mental health support.

title.children: Faith-based rehab provider accused of harming patients' chances of recovery

image.altText: A woman with windswept, dark hair wearing a black coat and white blouse turns a street corner with autumn foliage.

props.synopsis: Former Tasmanian MP Kathryn Hay has pleaded not guilty to a charge of emotional abuse or intimidation. The hearing in the Launceston Magistrates Court has ended, and the case will return to court in October.

title.children: Former MP and Miss Australia says she pleaded guilty to a previous charge of assaulting her ex-husband 'to let it go'

image.altText: Nic Porter screams

props.synopsis: The Australian men's water polo team is hell-bent on riding a wave of good form all the way to the knockout rounds, after a hard-fought, dramatic 9-8 victory over hosts France and their legions of fans.

title.children: How to Silence the Paris Crowd, by the Australian men's water polo team
